verses.verse: Now Jacob heard<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of Laban's sons,<WH1121> saying,<WH559> "Jacob<WH3290> has taken<WH3947> away all<WH3605> that was our father's, and from what<WH1> belonged to our father he has made<WH834> all<WH6213> this<WH3605> wealth.<WH2088>"
And Jacob<WH3290> saw<WH7200> the attitude<WH6440> of Laban,<WH3837> and behold,<WH2009> it was not [friendly] toward<WH5973> him as formerly.<WH8543>
Then the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "Return<WH7725> to the land<WH776> of your fathers and to your relatives,<WH1> and I will be with you."
So Jacob<WH3290> sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> Rachel<WH7354> and Leah<WH3812> to his flock<WH6629> in the field,<WH7704>
and said<WH559> to them, "I see<WH7200> your father's attitude,<WH1> that it is not [friendly] toward<WH6440> me as formerly,<WH413> but the God<WH8543> of my father has been<WH430> with me.
"And you know<WH3045> that I have served<WH5647> your father with all<WH1> my strength.<WH3605>
"Yet your father has cheated<WH1> me and changed<WH8524> my wages<WH2498> ten<WH4909> times;<WH6235> however, God<WH4489> did not allow<WH430> him to hurt<WH5414> me.

"If<WH518> he spoke<WH559> thus,<WH3541> 'The speckled<WH5348> shall be your wages,<WH7939>' then all<WH3605> the flock<WH6629> brought<WH3205> forth<WH3205> speckled;<WH5348> and if<WH518> he spoke<WH559> thus,<WH3541> 'The striped<WH6124> shall be your wages,<WH7939>' then all<WH3605> the flock<WH6629> brought<WH3205> forth<WH3205> striped.<WH6124>
"Thus God<WH430> has taken<WH5337> away<WH5337> your father's livestock<WH4735> and given<WH5414> [them] to me.

"And it came<WH1961> about at the time<WH6256> when the flock<WH6629> were mating<WH3179> that I lifted<WH5375> up my eyes<WH5869> and saw<WH7200> in a dream,<WH2472> and behold,<WH2009> the male<WH6260> goats<WH6260> which were mating<WH5927> [were] striped,<WH6124> speckled,<WH5348> and mottled.<WH1261>
"Then the angel<WH4397> of God<WH430> said<WH559> to me in the dream,<WH2472> 'Jacob,<WH3290>' and I said,<WH559> 'Here<WH2009> I am.'

"And he said,<WH559> 'Lift<WH5375> up, now,<WH4994> your eyes<WH5869> and see<WH7200> [that] all<WH3605> the male<WH6260> goats<WH6260> which are mating<WH5927> are striped,<WH6124> speckled,<WH5348> and mottled;<WH1261> for I have seen<WH7200> all<WH3605> that Laban<WH3837> has been doing<WH6213> to you.

'I am the God<WH410> [of] Bethel,<WH1008> where<WH834> <WH8033> you anointed<WH4886> a pillar,<WH4676> where<WH834> <WH8033> you made<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> to Me; now<WH6258> arise,<WH6965> leave<WH3318> this<WH2088> land,<WH776> and return<WH7725> to the land<WH776> of your birth.<WH4138>' "
And Rachel<WH7354> and Leah<WH3812> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to him, "Do we still<WH5750> have any portion<WH2506> or inheritance<WH5159> in our father's house<WH1004>?
"Are we not reckoned<WH2803> by him as foreigners<WH5237>? For he has sold<WH4376> us, and has also<WH1571> entirely<WH398> consumed<WH398> our purchase<WH3701> price.<WH3701>

"Surely<WH3588> all<WH3605> the wealth<WH6239> which<WH834> God<WH430> has taken<WH5337> away<WH5337> from our father belongs to us and our children;<WH1> now<WH1121> then, do<WH6258> whatever<WH6213> <WH3605> God<WH834> has said<WH430> to you."
Then Jacob<WH3290> arose<WH6965> and put<WH5375> his children<WH1121> and his wives<WH802> upon camels;<WH1581>

and he drove<WH5090> away<WH5090> all<WH3605> his livestock<WH4735> and all<WH3605> his property<WH7399> which<WH834> he had gathered,<WH7408> his acquired<WH7075> livestock<WH4735> which<WH834> he had gathered<WH7408> in Paddan-aram, to go<WH935> to the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667> to his father Isaac.<WH1>
When Laban<WH3837> had gone<WH1980> to shear<WH1494> his flock,<WH6629> then Rachel<WH7354> stole<WH1589> the household<WH8655> idols<WH8655> that were her father's.
And Jacob<WH3290> deceived<WH1589> Laban<WH3837> the Aramean,<WH761> by not telling<WH5046> him that he was fleeing.<WH1272>

So he fled<WH1272> with all<WH3605> that he had; and he arose<WH6965> and crossed<WH5674> the [Euphrates] River,<WH5104> and set<WH7760> his face<WH6440> toward the hill<WH2022> country<WH2022> of Gilead.<WH1568>
When it was told<WH5046> Laban<WH3837> on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117> that Jacob<WH3290> had fled,<WH1272>

then he took<WH3947> his kinsmen<WH251> with him, and pursued<WH7291> him [a distance of] seven<WH7651> days' journey;<WH1870> and he overtook<WH1692> him in the hill<WH2022> country<WH2022> of Gilead.<WH1568>

And God<WH430> came<WH935> to Laban<WH3837> the Aramean<WH761> in a dream<WH2472> of the night,<WH3915> and said<WH559> to him, "Be careful<WH8104> that you do not speak<WH1696> to Jacob<WH3290> either<WH4480> good<WH2896> or<WH5704> bad.<WH7451>"

And Laban<WH3837> caught<WH5381> up with Jacob.<WH3290> Now Jacob<WH3290> had pitched<WH8628> his tent<WH168> in the hill<WH2022> country,<WH2022> and Laban<WH3837> with his kinsmen<WH251> camped<WH8628> in the hill<WH2022> country<WH2022> of Gilead.<WH1568>

Then Laban<WH3837> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "What<WH4100> have you done<WH6213> by deceiving<WH1589> me and carrying<WH5090> away<WH5090> my daughters<WH1323> like captives<WH7617> of the sword<WH2719>?

"Why<WH4100> did you flee<WH1272> secretly<WH2244> and deceive<WH1589> me, and did not tell<WH5046> me, so that I might have sent<WH7971> you away<WH7971> with joy<WH8057> and with songs,<WH7892> with timbrel<WH8596> and with lyre;<WH3658>
and did not allow<WH5203> me to kiss<WH5401> my sons<WH1121> and my daughters<WH1323>? Now<WH6258> you have done<WH5528> <WH6213> foolishly.<WH5528>

"It is in my power<WH3027> to do<WH6213> you harm,<WH9563> but the God<WH430> of your father spoke<WH1> to me last<WH559> night,<WH570> saying,<WH570> 'Be careful<WH559> not to speak<WH8104> either<WH1696> good<WH4480> or<WH2896> bad<WH5704> to Jacob.<WH7451>'
"And now<WH6258> you have indeed<WH1980> gone<WH1980> away because<WH3588> you longed<WH3700> greatly<WH3700> for your father's house;<WH1004> [but] why<WH4100> did you steal<WH1589> my gods<WH430>?"

Then Jacob<WH3290> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to Laban,<WH3837> "Because<WH3588> I was afraid,<WH3372> for I said,<WH559> 'Lest<WH6435> you would take<WH1497> your daughters<WH1323> from me by force.<WH1497>'

"The one with whom<WH834> you find<WH4672> your gods<WH430> shall not live;<WH2421> in the presence<WH5048> of our kinsmen<WH251> point<WH5234> out what<WH4100> is yours among<WH5973> my belongings<WH5973> and take<WH3947> [it] for yourself." For Jacob<WH3290> did not know<WH3045> that Rachel<WH7354> had stolen<WH1589> them.

So Laban<WH3837> went<WH935> into Jacob's tent,<WH168> and into Leah's tent,<WH168> and into the tent<WH168> of the two<WH8147> maids,<WH519> but he did not find<WH4672> [them.] Then he went<WH3318> out of Leah's tent<WH168> and entered<WH935> Rachel's tent.<WH168>

Now Rachel<WH7354> had taken<WH3947> the household<WH8655> idols<WH8655> and put<WH7760> them in the camel's saddle,<WH9220> and she sat<WH3427> on them. And Laban<WH3837> felt<WH4959> through<WH4959> all<WH3605> the tent,<WH168> but did not find<WH4672> [them.]

And she said<WH559> to her father, "Let not my lord<WH1> be angry<WH113> that I cannot<WH2734> <WH3201> rise<WH3808> before<WH6965> <WH4480> you, for the manner<WH6440> of women<WH1870> is upon me." So he searched,<WH802> but did not find<WH2664> the household<WH4672> idols.<WH8655>

Then Jacob<WH3290> became<WH2734> angry<WH2734> and contended<WH7378> with Laban;<WH3837> and Jacob<WH3290> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to Laban,<WH3837> "What<WH4100> is my transgression<WH6588>? What<WH4100> is my sin,<WH9128> that you have hotly<WH1814> pursued<WH1814> me?

"Though<WH3588> you have felt<WH4959> through<WH4959> all<WH3605> my goods,<WH3627> what<WH4100> have you found<WH4672> of all<WH3605> your household<WH1004> goods<WH3627>? Set<WH7760> [it] here<WH3541> before<WH5048> my kinsmen<WH251> and your kinsmen,<WH251> that they may decide<WH3198> between<WH996> us two.<WH8147>

"These<WH2088> twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> I [have been] with you; your ewes<WH7353> and your female<WH5795> goats<WH5795> have not miscarried,<WH7921> nor<WH3808> have I eaten<WH398> the rams<WH352> of your flocks.<WH6629>

"That which was torn<WH2966> [of beasts] I did not bring<WH935> to you; I bore<WH2398> the loss<WH2398> of it myself.<WH595> You required<WH1245> it of my hand<WH3027> [whether] stolen<WH1589> by day<WH3117> or stolen<WH1589> by night.<WH3915>
"[Thus] I was: by day<WH3117> the heat<WH2721> consumed<WH398> me, and the frost<WH7140> by night,<WH3915> and my sleep<WH8142> fled<WH5074> from my eyes.<WH5869>

"These<WH2088> twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> I have been in your house;<WH1004> I served<WH5647> you fourteen<WH702> <WH6240> years<WH8141> for your two<WH8147> daughters,<WH1323> and six<WH8337> years<WH8141> for your flock,<WH6629> and you changed<WH2498> my wages<WH4909> ten<WH6235> times.<WH4489>

"If<WH3884> the God<WH430> of my father, the God<WH1> of Abraham,<WH430> and the fear<WH85> of Isaac,<WH6343> had<WH3327> not been<WH1961> for me, surely<WH1961> now<WH3588> you would have sent<WH6258> me away<WH7971> empty-handed. God<WH7971> has seen<WH430> my affliction<WH7200> and the toil<WH6040> of my hands,<WH3018> so He rendered<WH3709> judgment<WH3198> last<WH3198> night.<WH570>"

Then Laban<WH3837> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "The daughters<WH1323> are my daughters,<WH1323> and the children<WH1121> are my children,<WH1121> and the flocks<WH6629> are my flocks,<WH6629> and all<WH3605> that you see<WH7200> is mine. But what<WH4100> can I do<WH6213> this day<WH3117> to these<WH428> my daughters<WH1323> or<WH176> to their children<WH1121> whom<WH834> they have borne<WH3205>?
"So now<WH6258> come,<WH1980> let us make<WH3772> a covenant,<WH1285> you and I, and let it be a witness<WH5707> between<WH996> you and me."
Then Jacob<WH3290> took<WH3947> a stone<WH68> and set<WH7311> it up [as] a pillar.<WH4676>

And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> to his kinsmen,<WH251> "Gather<WH3950> stones.<WH68>" So they took<WH3947> stones<WH68> and made<WH6213> a heap,<WH1530> and they ate<WH398> there<WH8033> by the heap.<WH1530>
Now Laban<WH3837> called<WH7121> it Jegar-sahadutha, but Jacob<WH3290> called<WH7121> it Galeed.<WH1567>
And Laban<WH3837> said,<WH559> "This<WH2088> heap<WH1530> is a witness<WH5707> between<WH996> you and me this day.<WH3117>" Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> it was named<WH7121> <WH8034> Galeed;<WH1567>
and Mizpah,<WH4709> for he said,<WH559> "May the Lord<WH3068> watch<WH6822> between<WH996> you and me when<WH3588> we are absent<WH5641> one<WH376> from the other.<WH7453>

"If<WH518> you mistreat<WH6031> my daughters,<WH1323> or if<WH518> you take<WH3947> wives<WH802> besides<WH5921> my daughters,<WH1323> [although] no<WH369> man<WH376> is with us, see,<WH7200> God<WH430> is witness<WH5707> between<WH996> you and me."
And Laban<WH3837> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "Behold<WH2009> this<WH2088> heap<WH1530> and behold<WH2009> the pillar<WH4676> which<WH834> I have set<WH3384> between<WH996> you and me.

"This<WH2088> heap<WH1530> is a witness,<WH5707> and the pillar<WH4676> is a witness,<WH5713> that I will not pass<WH5674> by this<WH2088> heap<WH1530> to you for harm, and you will not pass<WH5674> by this<WH2088> heap<WH1530> and this<WH2088> pillar<WH4676> to me, for harm.<WH9567>

"The God<WH430> of Abraham<WH85> and the God<WH430> of Nahor,<WH5152> the God<WH430> of their father, judge<WH1> between<WH8199> us." So Jacob<WH996> swore<WH3290> by the fear<WH7650> of his father Isaac.<WH6343>
